attributes.action: Stop the April 2023 increase to energy prices cap.
attributes.additional_details: As gas costs have decreased, there is no longer any need for the planned increase.
attributes.background: Remove the planned price cap increase.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

The calculation of the energy price cap is a matter for the regulator Ofgem, which is operationally independent of the UK Government and House of Commons. You can find out more about how the price cap is calculated here: https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/information-consumers/energy-advice-households/check-if-energy-price-cap-affects-you

The Government has put in place the Energy Price Guarantee, to reduce the cost of energy for households. You can find out more about this scheme here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/energy-bills-support/energy-bills-support-factsheet-8-september-2022

We have also published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Subsidise energy and fuel prices to mitigate cost increases: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/622530

Reinstate the two year energy price guarantee: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/625700
